required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Predict Lanreotide-induced Disease Activity Normalization in Acromegaly
clinical_study.official_title: Non-interventional, Prospective Study to Predict Lanreotide-induced Disease Activity Normalization in Acromegaly

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to collect data about predictive factors for the efficacy of Lanreotide Autogel in patients with acromegaly in routine clinical practice.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study timeline delay, low site feasibility and delay concerns due to COVID-19.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with normalization of centrally assessed age and sex adjusted IGF-I levels at visit 4 (about 12 months) after treatment start with lanreotide autogel.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with normalization of centrally assessed age- and sex-adjusted IGF-I levels at visit 2, 3, and 5 after treatment start with lanreotide autogel
Changes from baseline of centrally assessed IGF-I levels at visit 2, 3, 4, 5 after treatment start with lanreotide autogel
Changes from baseline of centrally assessed random GH-levels at visit 2, 3, 4, 5 after treatment start with lanreotide autogel
Changes from baseline of centrally assessed GH-BP levels at visit 2, 3, 4, 5 after treatment start with lanreotide autogel
Proportion of subjects with GH-normalization - defined as centrally assessed random GH-levels (GH < 1 Î¼g/L) - at visits 2, 3, 4, and 5 during treatment with lanreotide autogel.
Predictors for reduction of age- and sex-adjusted IGF-I to normal levels (control of acromegaly) at visits 4 compared to baseline and Last Visit Available (LVA) compared to baseline.
Predictors of change in IGF-I between baseline compared to visit 4 and baseline compared to LVA.
Predictors of change in random GH-levels between baseline compared to visit 4 and baseline compared to LVA

secondary_outcome.description: Scale is used to assess the validity of Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC). the score ranges between 1= very much worse and 7 = very much improved

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in signs and symptoms (Numerical Rating Scale), patient's global impression of change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: It will be measured using Numerical Rating Scale to assess the average presence or severity of the symptoms. The score ranges from 0 = no symptom at all to 10 = maximum intensity of the symptom

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life between baseline and visits 2, 3, 4 and 5.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a generic, multipurpose short-form survey with 12 questions (SF-12). Scale provides information about mental and physical functioning and overall health-related-QoL. ". Higher scores indicate a better QoL.

study_pop.textblock: Adult subjects with biochemically active acromegaly, without previous treatment (medical treatment or radiotherapy) except for surgery and/or dopamine agonists (treatment terminated at or before baseline) who are already planned within the medical routine to be treated with lanreotide autogel.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged 18 years and older with the capacity to consent
- Signed written informed consent
- Subject with hormonally active acromegaly defined by locally measured IGF-I levels 1.3 times above the age- and sex-adjusted normal range as determined at the last routine visit before baseline and after surgery
- Subject with the intention to be treated with lanreotide autogel according to the current local SmPC (Germany, Austria) prior to study enrolment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in an interventional trial at the same time and/or within 3 months before baseline
- Subject represented by a legal guardian
